titleInfo.title: Camp Boxwell, Boy Scouts of America reservation, 1958 July 17

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A scene at Camp Boxwell, the Boy Scouts of America reservation circa July 17th 1958. K.C. Hardcastle, Jr. was instrumental in the process to acquire the land for Camp Boxwell. This scout camp was named in honor of Mr. L. G. Boxwell, president of the Nashville-area Council of the Boy Scouts of America. This scout camp was located at the Narrows of the Harpeth River in Middle Tennessee. Forms part of Nashville Banner Negatives Collection. 1 photographic negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
